question_text: A company runs a production database on Amazon RDS for MySQL. The company wants to upgrade the database version for security compliance reasons. Because the database contains critical data, the company wants a quick solution to upgrade and test functionality without losing any data. Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?

options.A: Create an RDS manual snapshot. Upgrade to the new version of Amazon RDS for MySQL.
options.B: Use native backup and restore. Restore the data to the upgraded new version of Amazon RDS for MySQL.
options.C: Use AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) to replicate the data to the upgraded new version of Amazon RDS for MySQL.
options.D: Use Amazon RDS Blue/Green Deployments to deploy and test production changes.
